summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York transmitting a grand jury subpoena to T-Mobile as part of a criminal investigation, with the attachment specifically naming Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her name appears in the filename of the attached grand jury subpoena, indicating the investigation relates to her.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email transmitting the grand jury subpoena to T-Mobile as part of a criminal investigation.

connections.description: The prosecutor is issuing legal process (subpoena) as part of a criminal investigation involving Maxwell.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to T-Mobile
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to T-Mobile, as indicated by the attached file, as part of a criminal investigation.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to T-Mobile on or about October 22, 2019, as part of a criminal investigation.
The subpoena attachment filename includes Ghislaine Maxwell's name, directly linking the investigation to her.
The communication is from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating active federal prosecution.
The subpoena seeks records from a telecommunications provider (T-Mobile), suggesting investigators were seeking communication records.
